newsitem.title: POLAND: SOKOLOW SEEKS 15 PCT OF MARKET BY 1999.
newsitem.headline: SOKOLOW SEEKS 15 PCT OF MARKET BY 1999.

text.p: The Polish meat processing company Sokolow SA wants to increase its domestic market share to 15 percent in the next three years from the current six percent, the company's president said.
"In the next three years we hope to have 15 percent of the market," Jan Augustynowicz told a seminar on Poland's meat processing market.
He said this should be possible thanks to a planned increase of production at Sokolow and the buying of other meat-processing companies.
"We see our future in the sector in consolidation," he said, adding that the company would invest a total of 20 million zlotys this year.
